task.summary: Default task
Added username and password boxes
added sqllite
users database
Added remaining data points
Database points
Updated logs
Added lastname to Users.cs
Removed white space
Working labels
ADDED LOGO
Added image and finsihed login page
Addded Create Account Page
Create Account page
Added create account screen with some funcationality
Added dahboard page with header bar

Update DashboardPage layout and color scheme
Changed the background color and adjusted the top header height in the DashboardPage view. Additionally, the color for each row was modified and a logo image was added to the header.

Center align logo in DashboardPage
The logo in the dashboard page of the SeniorProjectHealthApplication was previously aligned horizontally. This commit changes the alignment to vertical for better visual presentation.

Add new DashboardCategory and MealPage views
Introduced new views to handle category-based meal selection: DashboardCategory and MealPage. DashboardCategory is a custom control used to display meal categories on the dashboard which when clicked will redirect to the MealPage. The MealPage displays specific meals for the selected category. Updated the layout of the dashboard and added different meal icon resources.

Add Xamarin.CommunityToolkit and tap gesture recognizer
The Xamarin.CommunityToolkit package has been added to the .csproj files for the SeniorProjectHealthApplication, Android, and iOS. In the DashboardCategory view, a tap gesture recognizer has been added within a Grid. The gesture is handled by the method OnTapGestureTapped in the DashboardCategory view's code-behind. This results in a cleaner and more maintainable way of capturing and handling the tap event.

Update Xamarin package versions and add Xamarin.CommunityToolkit
This commit updates the versions of Xamarin.Forms and Xamarin.Essentials in the SeniorProjectHealthApplication. Additionally, it includes the Xamarin.CommunityToolkit package across all the application projects (main, Android, and iOS). This would maintain consistency in Xamarin package versions across the different platforms and provide access to additional features and helpers from the toolkit.

Add PancakeView package to Xamarin projects
The PancakeView package (version 2.3.0.763-beta) has been introduced to both the main and Android-specific Xamarin project files. This provides access to additional UI components and functionalities.

Add QuickNavBar to multiple pages and update navigation
QuickNavBar is added to the Workouts, WorkoutScreen, Progress, and Recipes pages for better navigation between these pages. Also, the event handlers in QuickNavBar.xaml.cs are updated to navigate to the respective pages, replacing the placeholders. In App.xaml.cs, the initial MainPage is changed from DashboardPage to WorkoutScreen.

Update UI color references to use resource dictionary
Color references in the UI of the Health Application have been replaced with entries from the resource dictionary. This change accommodates the two newly created color resources "UMCMaroon" and "UMCGold". It also includes updates in XAML files and Android's Resource.designer.cs file. This change allows better code reusability and easier color management in future design updates.

Remove AboutPage and ItemsPage, update WorkoutVideo and DashboardPage
Deleted the obsolete AboutPage.xaml and ItemsPage.xaml along with their corresponding .cs and ViewModel files. Added missing files in WorkoutScreen.xaml.cs and WorkoutVideo.xaml for functionality. Also, updated the DashboardPage.xaml with new attributes and icons.

Refactor project structure and enhance password recovery feature
This update comprises of a project restructuring where related views have been grouped in appropriate sub-folders for better organization and enhanced maintainability of the codebase. Additionally, the password recovery feature in the login has been updated to include navigation to the login page after the recovery process initiates. This refractor will significantly enhance code manageability and navigation.

Renamed and updated SettingsPage, improved navigation
The SettingsPage has been renamed and relocated to a Settings directory for better organization. Clickable navigation buttons have been added for 'Notifications', 'Help and Support', 'Privacy and Security', and 'Account', to improve user experience and interactivity. Further, color resources have been used instead of hard-coding, aligning with coding best practices, and 'Account_Clicked' now navigates to SettingsPage in DashboardPage. Additionally, the 'OpenFoodPage' function in DashboardCategory now initiates Navigation to MealPage. The auto binding redirects in iOS project file have been removed.

Add AddFoodPage with back and barcode functionality
Created a new AddFoodPage in the Food view and implemented functionality for a back button and a barcode button. This page was originally named MealPage and has been renamed to AddFoodPage. Furthermore, unnecessary using directives in multiple database models were removed and the syntax of primary key declarations in the same models was improved.

Implement user registration and modify UI components
This commit adds functionality to create a user account and store its details in a SQLite database. The database manager has been initialized to handle common database operations. The QuickNavBar button alignment has been updated for better responsiveness, besides minor updates to the ViewModel and XAML views. An overlay for the QuickAdd button has been prepared but is currently commented out.

Add birthdate and gender fields to user account creation
In the CreateAccountViewModel, 'Birthdate' and 'SelectedGender' properties are added and utilized when creating a new user. On the CreateAccountPage front-end, corresponding fields and interactivity for date of birth and gender selection are created for user input.

Change user creation to user retrieval in CreateAccountViewModel
In this commit, the logic within the CreateAccountViewModel has been adjusted. Instead of creating and adding a new user to the database, it's now fetching an existing user's information from the data source. User creation code has been commented out for possible future use.

Implement user account management
Added functionality to manage user accounts. Users can now view their settings, modify personal information and securely store changes to their password. Also, included secure password hashing using BCrypt. Furthermore, the database has been updated to facilitate these changes.

Enhance user profile settings and refactor page names
Updated user profile setting by allowing users to set their current weight, goal weight, and height. Additionally, refactored several names related to pages (like `Progress` to `ProgressPage`) to improve consistency and clarity throughout the codebase.

Refactor UpdateItem method in DatabaseManager
Removed unnecessary lines of code and whitespace for improved readability and performance. The UpdateItem method inside the DatabaseManager has been streamlined and now correctly accesses the _db object to update items without any interference.

Add date navigation and food log creation to Dashboard
Incorporated date navigation functionality to the DashboardPage and changed display labels to buttons. Implemented food log creation for the selected date if it does not already exist. Added additional functions to the DatabaseManager to handle new functions.

Add dynamic calorie display functionality
The "Calories Left" label on the DashboardPage.xaml has been edited to display dynamically updated calorie information. A new class, UserDataManager, has been created to calculate the user's BMR (Basal Metabolic Rate) based on their age, height, and weight. This value is then used to display the number of calories the user has left for the day. This commit also includes changes in DashboardPage.xaml.cs to load user data and calculate the current age.

Refactor BMR calculation and database loading
BMR calculation and database loading methods were moved to the UserDataManager class. This change eliminates direct dependencies on the DatabaseManager within the DashboardPage.xaml.cs and streamlines the application's architecture by centralizing the data management. Additionally, the BMR calculation now considers user data pulled directly from the database.

Refactor food item property and clean up XAML
Modified the `FoodItem` model to rename 'Total_Calorie' to 'Total_Calories' for better semantics. Cleaned up and simplified the XAML code for `FoodCategoryPage` by removing commented out code and adjusting margins for better formatting. Additionally, minor adjustments were made in `ViewFoodItem_Tapped` method and `FoodCategoryViewModel` for clarity and code consistency.

Add library files and update .gitignore
This commit includes the addition of multiple library files for the SeniorProjectHealthApplication. Additionally, the .gitignore file was updated for better project hygiene. The library files mostly include a variety of AndroidX libraries, increasing the functionality and compatibility of the application.

Update workout UI and enhance navigation
The workout user interface has been updated with changes to the command parameter. The code is also modified to make the workout execution method asynchronous for better user experience. The 'back' button is introduced to allow easier navigation from the WebView. The method ExerciseDatabaseExist() in App.xaml.cs has been renamed to GenerateExerciseDatabase() to better reflect its functionality.

Add method to check database table existence
A CheckTableExists method has been added to DatabaseManager.cs to ensure that the ExerciseDatabase exists. In App.xaml.cs, this method is called to check for table existence. If result is zero, the database table is generated. This simplifies and improves database initialization.
